title.title: The Definition of Juggling
title.content: Please post questions and discussions regarding the definition of juggling here. Erik and I will answer and participate as we can. We will also try to collect all the questions and comments from other places (such as Facebook) and focus the answers here…

replies.title: The Definition of Juggling
replies.content: Why do you have to put balancing a stick into a genre? Why can’t it be just balancing? If I stand on the street and balance a stick, and you ask everyone who walks by “What is he doing?” I would guess nobody would say “juggling”. Maybe in 1920, someone would have said “That’s a clever bit of juggling”, but I don’t think it would happen today.

replies.title: The Definition of Juggling
replies.content: Please post questions and discussions regarding the definition of juggling here. Erik and I will answer and participate as we can. We will also try to collect all the questions and comments from other places (such as Facebook) and focus the answers here…

replies.title: The Definition of Juggling
replies.content: Why do you have to put balancing a stick into a genre? Why can’t it be just balancing? If I stand on the street and balance a stick, and you ask everyone who walks by “What is he doing?” I would guess nobody would say “juggling”. Maybe in 1920, someone would have said “That’s a clever bit of juggling”, but I don’t think it would happen today.

replies.title: The Definition of Juggling
replies.content:
Hey Jack,
I think this definition raises some interesting points. However, before I ask about them, I want to clarify (since this has caused confusion in the past), is this a definition for the genre of juggling, the activity of juggling, or is it a definition for toss juggling specifically?

replies.username: Save this url in the Wayback Machine
replies.title: Internet Archive's Wayback Machine
replies.content: Why do you have to put balancing a stick into a genre? Why can’t it be just balancing? If I stand on the street and balance a stick, and you ask everyone who walks by “What is he doing?” I would guess nobody would say “juggling”. Maybe in 1920, someone would have said “That’s a clever bit of juggling”, but I don’t think it would happen today.

title.title: Object Episodes
title.content: Facebook is a barrier of entry for many object manipulators, and though it currently contains some of the healthiest levels of communication, it is not searchable in the way this forum software is. With much respect to independent forums such as The Juggling Edge, The WJF, and Anthony’s Juggling Talk, the goal of Object Episodes is to provide a consistent place to collect thoughts and content- the platform is mobile friendly and easily incorporates links, photos, and videos. Special thanks to Brian Crabtree and Erik Åberg for help and advice in setting this up.

title.title: Juggling movies
title.content: What have you guys to add? Names/details/stories? I’ll try to expand this later.

title.content: Square:

Start with a club passing ! and others levitating object.

title.title: Areas of juggling knowledge
title.content: Are there health benefits (or dangers) from juggling, and how can they be proven? what evidence is there for juggling’s effect on the body and mind?

title.title: Eleven rings list
title.content: Earl Shatford https://youtu.be/WGH8vfncs2c?t=2m18s also http://juggle.wikia.com/wiki/Earl_Shatford claims 20 catches.

title.title: Juggling and Wayne McGregor's project ''Thinking with the body''
title.content:
Hi,
i was looking yesterday the project of the choreographer Wayne McGregor about dancing and the thinking of the body and i was wondering if it is possible to find any links with the connection of our bodies and the objects through this perspective.

title.title: Language wishlist thread (for fun)
title.content: Luke Wilson mentioned that one of the first things you find out about a new prop that you want to research is to what extent it can be safely dropped. I believe having props with a high level of “dropability” (won’t break easily, won’t break the floor easily, won’t break the juggler easily) is of great importance if one wishes to do some casual juggling. Of course, it’s not the only factor, but I really wish there was a word to describe such an attribute. Maybe there is a suitable word?

title.title: The Moschen Triangle and the Kennedy Cone
title.content: I do not know how to define the line between what’s copyable and what’s not. It’s generally obvious when I see a unique act what parts are fair game to try out (even with the intent of eventually performing) and which are not. But it’s hard to put it into words. I’ll certainly think about it more now. And I think that the line is moving all the time, too. Eating the apple was probably someone’s trademark at one time, but perhaps when the originator died is when it went into public domain?

title.title: Luke Burrage’s juggling/spoken word routine
title.content: I think you mean https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6eWn0dRHwIQ

title.title: Juggling and (video) games?
title.content: Discuss?

title.title: 53 ball juggling techniques
title.content: What are your favorite technique variations for juggling? Which ones do you practice, which ones do you perform?

title.title: Multiplex history
title.content:
Personally, my big reference about this topic is Sergeï Ignatov, the first I saw on TV when I started juggling, who threw several clubs at a time in a juggling pattern. Then, several jugglers and former students of CNAC extensively used this technique with clubs in the 1980-1990s. I can also think of the Gatto Multiplex within a 5 or 7 ball cascade.
Only starting a pattern by throwing several props at a time, then not using multiplex within the pattern, also counts in my opinion as a multiplex (i.e Kris Kremo with 3 balls), although I don’t think it expresses the same level of integration.
My intuition is that this technique could be a marker to help defining certain juggling historical periods : holding more than one prop in the same hand is / is not called juggling according to context.
Any other thoughts or info to share ?
Thanks !

title.title: Renegade Design Lab
title.content:
Hello everybody, maybe Erik and Jay ?
Could you make a short history of RDL or give references to it ? a few dates ? I didn’t find much info elsewhere.
Thanks
Denis

title.title: The Importance of a Jugglers Status in the Community
title.content:
I guess if you’re in the “in” group you would not notice things like these.
Would an anonymous juggling forum be a good thing?

title.title: Analyse a Juggling Act like a Poem or Piece of Art
title.content: (P.s. sorry for the long text, i might unnecessarily overexplain some things that are already clear to everybody. But i think it’s important to lay out my thoughts in such a way, that you know where my logical chains start from:))

title.title: Tactile by Luke Wilson - Favorite bits
title.content: I lent the book to an interested non-juggler, will be fun to hear what they thought of it later.

title.title: Still Unjuggled
title.content: But what about you? What do you want to see? And will you do it yourself, or are you hoping to discover it through others?

title.title: A Dictionary Definition of Juggling?
title.content: https://www.facebook.com/arthur.lewbel/posts/10156175366321414"

title.title: Juggle Jabber 2018 & feedback
title.content: Perhaps you already do, but I suggest you look on youtube for tips and tricks about lighting and sounding. As well as interviews, to see what you like about them and what you don’t like about them.

title.title: Perfect juggler/juggling?
title.content:
But in all seriousness:
Perfect for what purpose? If I know which task your perfect juggler has to do, I could perhaps tell you what I think would be perfect…

title.title: Comedy juggling vs. juggling comedy?
title.content: I am wondering if people think it’s a problem that there are two different meanings of this phrase. Should the traditional version be changed to “juggling comedy,” since (to paraphrase Jay Gilligan’s episode of Juggle Jabber) comedy is generally more important than juggling in that genre? Would Wes’ version of comedy juggling be more accurately described as “comedic juggling” or some other name?

title.title: Listing of discussions on online communities
Facebook discussions
title.content: I honestly don’t think Facebook is the best platform for serious juggling discussions. For more open and serious discussion I would turn to other sites. That being said, the people on JugglingRock always seem to have interesting opinions…

title.title: Greyscale vs. Color
title.content: As for my props, I want my tools to be fun to work with, so I pick a color which attracts me (yellow). To save myself from making arbitrary choices and some distractions, I also limit myself to yellow.

title.title: I owe Jay Gilligan and Eric an apology
title.content:
Thanks, but I do not think you have to apologize. In fact, I think leaning towards skepticism when someone presents new ideas is probably correct. You gotta flip and grill these new ideas for a while, before they come out good!
I welcome skeptics, but I suggest that when you can’t produce an argument anymore, you should probably reconsider your stance, from a clean slate. I know that my written communication can improve a lot, and that there is also a language barrier. But I still have not encountered any real argument against what I presented as a definition, other than that the 3b cascade is a somewhat fictional anchor to it. But that is something I have admitted from the very beginning, and I gave an account of the real truth too. Either way, I am still super happy to discuss with anyone that is sincere about the matter.

title.title: Juggling Language: Drop
title.content: obviously a 9 club flash is more on the upper limit of what we think is currently possible with juggling. maybe i am more forgiving for this reason. but when i watch other videos and someone catches a wrong end of a club i always think to myself “just film it again!” especially when its clear they can do the trick with minimal effort. for me then a drop is what luke says, any failure of intention. and yes, i know you can catch a club by “the wrong end” on purpose, but then that is usually demonstrated and communicated by what kind of technique is chosen.

title.title: Is the top 40 the new rec.juggling?
title.content: To me, the first unifiying place that comes to mind is EJC. I’ll value anything that goes on there above what happens at jRock or top40!

title.title: The definition of juggling?
title.content: For the moment that sounds pretty good. Though all the definitions I've went through in the past years have sounded great at first, and then of course they start to fall apart later on.

replies.title: The definition of juggling?
replies.content: I'm keen to see what @Erik and @instantjuggler in particular think about this. I'm very interested in the role of intent and perception of that intent.

title.title: I owe Jay Gilligan and Eric an apology
title.content:
Thanks, but I do not think you have to apologize. In fact, I think leaning towards skepticism when someone presents new ideas is probably correct. You gotta flip and grill these new ideas for a while, before they come out good!
I welcome skeptics, but I suggest that when you can’t produce an argument anymore, you should probably reconsider your stance, from a clean slate. I know that my written communication can improve a lot, and that there is also a language barrier. But I still have not encountered any real argument against what I presented as a definition, other than that the 3b cascade is a somewhat fictional anchor to it. But that is something I have admitted from the very beginning, and I gave an account of the real truth too. Either way, I am still super happy to discuss with anyone that is sincere about the matter.

title.content: obviously a 9 club flash is more on the upper limit of what we think is currently possible with juggling. maybe i am more forgiving for this reason. but when i watch other videos and someone catches a wrong end of a club i always think to myself “just film it again!” especially when its clear they can do the trick with minimal effort. for me then a drop is what luke says, any failure of intention. and yes, i know you can catch a club by “the wrong end” on purpose, but then that is usually demonstrated and communicated by what kind of technique is chosen.
